bencoding
Class TorrentDecoder

java.lang.Object
  bencoding.TorrentDecoder

public class TorrentDecoder
extends java.lang.Object

TorrentDecoder class Parses and extracts data from a torrent file with a single tracker and single file.

Author:
Ari Hayes

TorrentDecoder

public TorrentDecoder(java.lang.String file)
               throws java.io.IOException
Creates a TorrentDecoder object, and parses the specified file to get metadata.

Parameters:
file - A String identifying the torrent file on disc.
Throws:
java.io.IOException - on unexpected IO error.
Method Detail

parseDictionary

boolean parseDictionary(int dictionary_id)
                  throws java.io.IOException
Called by constructor, usually indirectly, to help parse torrent file.

Parameters:
dictionary_id - Indicates whether in root dictionary, or info dictionary, etc.
Returns:
true if syntactically correct dictionary is parsed successfully, false on failure.
Throws:
java.io.IOException - on failure reading stream

                     throws java.io.IOException
Parses the SHA-1 hashes from the file stream.

Returns:
true on success, false on failure.
Throws:
java.io.IOException

                               int first_digit)
                         throws java.io.IOException
Parses an integer at current offset of the stream.

Parameters:
end_byte - The byte signaling the end of the integer, either ':' or 'e'

Returns:

java.io.IOException - on failure reading stream
